description:
Non material minor adendment of planning permission ref: P111988 dated 6 January 2012 for the Demolition of the existing Twelve Acres Homeless Reception Centre buildings (including the single storey building that connects Riversdene House to the Twelve Acres buildings) and the construction of a 3 storey residential terrace and a part 2, part 5 storey residential flatted block fronting Riversdale Road and a three storey terrace fronting Highbury Quadrant to provide for 38 residential dwellings. The proposals include the relocation of substation services into the substation structure currently located in the east of the site (rear of the White House public house) and other associated works including boundary treatment and gates and other landscaping works. Note: Riversdene House is not to be demolished. Landscaping around this building is proposed and that is the reason for this buildings inclusion within the site.
The amendments to the approved scheme applied for are:
-	increase the projection of the zinc cladding to the five (5) front elevation balconies of block B/C (fronting Riversdale Road)
-	the rear elevation of block B/C (5 storey building) has seen the balconies within the upper two floors (clad in zinc) have had the alignment with the windows in the floors below slightly adjusted;
